references: Apart from studies that utilize NNs to approximate regular MHEs for faster implementations, most NMHE approaches remain computationally intensive. This is due to the simultaneous need to run NN models and nonlinear constrained optimization algorithms. Unfortunately, not all studies provide details of their NMHE running times and computing hardware. For those that do, Table 2 compiles the running times of NMHE implementations, along with the computing hardware and the length of the horizon, both of which significantly impact the computational load of the estimator.

Sx1.T3.caption: Table 3: List of NMHE studies included in this systematic reviewTable 3: Details of Studies Included (continued)
Sx1.T3.table:
Reference Objective Case study
[17] To use NNs as the predictor in MHE formulation, leveraging NNs for better state estimation accuracy Free moving point-mass object
[22] To estimate external force/torque information and disturbance rejection using NMHE Bilateral teleoperation of robotic manipulators
[23] To leverage NMHE for enhanced state estimation in different applications State estimation for an inverted pendulum using partial measurements, localization for a ground robot, and state estimation for a quadrotor
[24] To enhance the accuracy of car sideslip angle estimation using NMHE Car chassis control
[25] To leverage NMHE for high-performance state estimation Autonomous racing of cars
[26] Identify battery parameters and estimate SOC with high precision Lithium-ion batteries
[27] Estimate HVAC systems state variables using only building management system data Building HVAC control for occupant comfort satisfaction and energy-savings
[28] For online estimation of pedestrian position, velocity, and acceleration Pedestrian localization for car autonomous navigation
[29] To remove motion artifact from electrocardiogram signals Electrocardiogram signal processing
[30] Estimate state variables using basic measurements for process monitoring, eliminating the need for expensive sensors Online monitoring of brewery wastewater anaerobic digester
[31] Reduce modeling errors in gray-box system identification 2-DOF robotic manipulator
[32] Overcome the low accuracy of traditional tire models, enabling high-fidelity fault identification Fault detection and diagnosis of car tires
[33] Detect cyberattacks in complex process networks The integrated process of benzene alkylation with ethylene to produce ethylbenzene
[43] Identify terrain parameters using low-cost sensors Mobile robot
[34] Enable accurate state estimation in the absence of reliable system models Climate control of smart building
[35] Develop an auto-tuning state estimator for varying conditions Quadrotor disturbance estimation
[36] Develop an auto-tuning state estimator for varying conditions Quadrotor disturbance estimation
[37] Use trust-region policy optimization for an adaptable state estimator Quadrotor disturbance estimation
[38] Approximate MHE with NNs for fast state estimation Inverted Pendulum
[39] Approximate MHE with NNs for fast state estimation, integrating it with MPC Industrial batch polymerization reactor
[40] Approximate MHE with NNs for fast state estimation Inverted Pendulum
